column1: San José de Guanipa (Spanish pronunciation: [saŋ xoˈse ðe ɣwaˈnipa])
column3: is a city in the state of Anzoátegui
column4: Venezuela. It is the capital of  Guanipa Municipality. Officially founded in 1910
column5: it was previously a settlement of the Kali'na people.  El Tigrito lies between the larger town El Tigre and the oil camp of San Tomé.

column2: the city is named for the Kali'na cacique Guanipa.
